intro: Micromeria graeca var. longiflora, commonly known as the Greek micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a peppery or spicy scent when crushed. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
